visual_style: antique parchment background with subtle grain
clean TCG UI language with a large art window

rarity_system.render_rule: Render a small flat icon followed immediately by the rarity text. No parentheses. No 'Rarity:' label. No extra symbols. No gradients.

stat_pips.filled_style: solid navy fill with gold outline

content.ART_PROMPT: A moonlit caravan of eastern scholars approaching a distant city beneath a brilliant star; ancient Near Eastern travel; subtle wonder; painterly mythic realism; parchment-friendly tones; no text in art
content.ABILITY_TEXT: On draw, you may reveal: spend 1 card from your hand to activate that card’s on-reveal ability. Then this card is spent.

content.NT_VERSE_SNIPPET: magi from the east came to Jerusalem
content.NT_VERSE_LINE: Matt 2:1 — “magi from the east came to Jerusalem …”
TRIVIA_BULLETS: Matthew never calls them kings, and never gives a number.
The same Greek root appears in Acts 13:6 in a negative context.
Daniel’s court vocabulary overlaps with ‘wise/magician’ categories.
This label’s moral weight is decided by context, not the word alone.
content.NOTES_INTERNAL: Hidden metadata only. Do not render as visible rule panels.

model_prompt: Generate a premium vertical trading card using the provided style_guide, layout, and content. Output must contain ONLY the card; do not add any surrounding text, captions, watermarks, or extra labels outside the card border. Do not render any top microtext such as 'GAME: HYPERTEXT' or 'DECK: WORD STUDIES' anywhere. The rarity indicator must be a small flat icon followed immediately by the rarity word from RARITY_TEXT. For MYTHIC, the icon must be a true 4-sided diamond (rhombus), not a rotated square, and it must be orange with a navy outline. Do not print '(Rarity)' and do not print 'Rarity:'. For stats, use only circular pips. The top 44% must be an illustration matching ART_PROMPT with no text inside the artwork. Render only these sections: header, stats, ability, OT verse, NT verse, Greek/Heb split strip, and trivia bullets. Do not add rulebook panels. Each heading appears once. Ensure Greek and Hebrew render correctly (Hebrew right-to-left).
